p: Influenza epidemiology mainly depends on the particular characteristics of influenza viruses (IVs), able to spread all over the world and rapidly evolve. Furthermore, a gradual and relatively continuous change in the surface glycoproteins, hemagglutinin (HA) and neuraminidase (NA), allows them to escape the immunity that comes from prior infections or vaccination ( 2). Because of this, seasonal epidemics recur every year with different intensity and trend.
